thread.title: 2015 Savannah Film Festival gets under way
thread.title_full: 2015 Savannah Film Festival gets under way | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: 2015 Savannah Film Festival gets under way
text:
By Savannah Morning News Savannah gets a little more starry today now that the 2015 Savannah Film Festival is ready to get started.
Tickets are still available to many events, which you can find at filmfest.scad.edu and at dosavannah.com.
Here are some of the highlights:
Oct. 24
7:30 p.m.: Director Sarah Gavron and producer Alison Owen will attend the opening night screening of “Suffragette” at the Trustees Theater.
9:30 p.m.: Actress Olivia Wilde will receive the Spotlight Award before the screening of her film “Meadowland” at the Lucas Theatre. The film’s director, Reed Morano, will attend.
Oct. 25
7:30 p.m.: The festival will host “An Evening with Saoirse Ronan” following the screening of her film “Brooklyn” at the Trustees Theater.
Oct. 26
12:30 p.m.: Alexander Skarsgard, of “True Blood” fame, will attend the Q&A after the screening of his film “The Diary of a Teenage Girl.”
Oct. 27
7 p.m.: Actor Alfie Allen will receive the Rising Star Award before a screening at the Trustees Theater.
Oct. 29
7 p.m.: Actress/director Meg Ryan will receive the Lifetime Achievement Award before the screening of her new film “Ithaca,” which she directs and stars in. This will take place at the Trustees Theater. Additional cast from the film will also attend.
Oct. 31
7 p.m.: Actress Elizabeth Olsen and director Marc Abraham will attend the closing night screening of “I Saw the Light” at the Trustees Theater.
